thread.title: Rockne News: Rockne singer wins big at Country Music Showdown
thread.title_full: Rockne News: Rockne singer wins big at Country Music Showdown | www.statesman.com

author: Lea Ann Goertz Lee
title: Rockne News: Rockne singer wins big at Country Music Showdown
text:
Congratulations to Logan Tucker, who won First Place at the state level in the Country Music Showdown in Rockport last weekend. He will go on to compete in the regionals, which take place in Raton, New Mexico.
Hendrix Reunion
The Hendrix Family Reunion was held on Sunday, October 3, at the pavilion located on the Hendrix Cemetery grounds. A silent auction was held before the meal that raised $1,140 which will go towards any maintenance and improvements needed at the cemetery. The silent auction was able to raise so much due to the impressive offerings, including an antique collection of thimbles, jewelry, a quilt square with the family coat of arms, homemade cinnamon rolls and handmade wooden items.
Rockne News reporter Lea Ann Lee was the lucky winner of this basket made by Theresa Gullikson, right, at the VFW Post 2527 Annual Celebration. CONTRIBUTED FOR AUSTIN COMMUNITY NEWSPAPERS Delicious barbecue chicken is served each year, along with potluck sides. After the meal, certificates of recognition were given for the oldest male attendee, Curtis Osborn, the oldest female, Ella Sheffield and the youngest family member present, Calen Hendrix at 6 months old. John and Linda Szuba traveled the farthest, coming from Omaha, Nebraska. Group photos were also taken this year as people visited and enjoyed a beautiful Sunday together.
VFW Annual Celebration
The VFW Post 2527 in Rockne held its annual celebration last Saturday, October 10. A fried chicken dinner was served, and many participated in the raffle drawing and a country store game where they won homemade baked and canned goods. Next year will be the 60th annual Celebration for Post 2537.
Watterson Dance
The Nathan Young Band will play at Watterson Hall on Saturday, October 24. Cover is $7 and the band plays from 9 p.m. until 1 a.m. The grill gets fired up around 6 p.m., so come early and enjoy one of their famous Watterson burgers.
Rockne Ramble
Mark your calendars for the first annual Rockne Ramble 2K and 5K Run and Walk on November 7. Participants will meet at Sacred Heart Catholic Church for registration from 6:30 to 7:30 a.m. and the 5K Run starts at 8 a.m. The 2K Run/Walk will start at 8:15 a.m. Early bird registration is $30 per person, $55 per couple and $80 for a family of four. The registration fees will go up after October 16, so contact Marsha Ireland at (512) 897-7050 or sacredheartchurch.events@gmail.com to register now. All proceeds will benefit the Sacred Heart Parish Pilgrimage to Poland for World Youth Day.
Contact Rockne News
I would love to share your news and events from the Rockne area. Send information and digital photos to rocknenews@gmail.com.
